oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vanderbilt and UT bands on Shields-Watkins field at the football game in Knoxville, Tennessee, 1937 November 13
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the marching bands of Vanderbilt University and the University of Tennessee-Knoxville on the Shields-Watkins field in Knoxville. The gridiron match between the rival football teams took place on November 13, 1937. Football fans from both schools arrived hours earlier than the 2:00 p.m. kickoff. The bands played their respective college tunes and the National Anthem was played when the opposing teams ran onto the field. The Vanderbilt Commodores won the game 13 to 7. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 snapshot photograph : b & w ; 3.5 x 4.75 in.
